I am using a package JuAFEM to do 2D analysis of a simple mesh. I want to use the addfaceset function to create a faceset to apply the traction on that faceset but in the addfaceset  function it doesnot support to use && operator. I have attached the picture of my mesh. I want to apply the traction on the left corner part.  Can anybody give me an idea how to addfaceset only at the left corner so that I can apply the traction.

```addfaceset!(grid, "bottom", x -> (abs(x[2]) ≈ 0.0)) # select all nodes with x[2] coordinate = 0.0
addfaceset!(grid, "left", x -> (abs(x[1]) ≈ 0.0))# select all nodes with x[1] coordinate = 0.0
addfaceset!(grid, "right", x -> (abs(x[1]) ≈ 5.0))
addfaceset!(grid, "top", x -> (abs(x[2])≈ 5.0))
#addfaceset!(grid, "topleft", x -> (abs(x[2])≈ 5.0) && x -> (abs(x[1]) ≈ 0: 0.5))```

With addfaceset! you are adding all faces (=the sides of your elements) for which the given function evaluates to true to a faceset. So you would need to use && inside a single (anonymous) function definition.
